What is Personal Accident Insurance?
Personal accident insurance, as the name implies, protects the insured and his or her dependents, and provides timely financial assistance to the insured family in the event of an unfortunate accident such as a household accident or sports injury. Different insurance providers have different definitions of "accidents", but most of which are "accidents that are not caused by diseases". Generally speaking, personal accident insurance covers:
Accidental Death
Dismemberment
Permanent disability
Weekly Allowance During Temporary Disablement
Medical expenses

Personal accident insurance can be purchased as a stand-alone policy or as an add-on to a life insurance policy.

In addition, the compensation is mainly paid in the following ways:
One-off
According to actual reimbursement of medical and hospital expenses
Weekly/daily allowance for the period specified in the policy
Personal accident insurance coverage
Traffic accident
Personal accident insurance covers the insured against serious injury or death caused by public transport or private cars.
Accidental deaths and medical expenses caused by natural disasters
Some insurance policies will cover accidental deaths and medical expenses caused by natural disasters such as landslides, fires, home explosions or lightning strikes. However, some insurance companies do not cover it, so the insured should take the time to carefully read the exclusions before purchasing the insurance.
Accidents caused by amateur dangerous sports
Personal accident insurance protects the insured from serious injury or death caused by dangerous amateur sports, but some insurance companies do not cover high-risk activities such as racing, horse racing, rock climbing, extreme sports, etc.
Overseas accident
If the policyholder encounters an accident overseas, which results in serious injury or death, personal accident insurance will provide relevant coverage.
Accidental medical treatment
Personal accident insurance will cover all expenses as a result of accidental injury, including medical treatment, surgery, hospitalization, chiropractic and physiotherapy.

Things commonly not covered under personal accident insurance policy
Common exclusions in accident insurance generally include "high-risk" activities. It is best to take the time to understand the exclusions of different insurance plans before applying for the insurance. Common exclusions are listed as follows:

Pre-existing medical conditions
Plastic surgery
Suicide
Illegal act
Riot
Casualties caused by wars
Accidental casualties and medical expenses due to natural disasters
Death by natural causes
Accident due to taking over-the-counter drugs or under the influence of alcohol
Participate in high-risk activities such as racing, horse racing, rock climbing, extreme sports, American football, ice hockey, etc.
Pregnancy-related accidents or complications
Things you should know before buying personal accident insurance
Before purchasing personal accident insurance, you should pay attention to the following matters and choose the personal accident insurance plan that is most suitable for you:
People of all age will also benefit from personal accident insurance
Accidents can happen to everyone irrespective of age. It will not only result in loss of income, but also incurs huge medical expenses, creating a huge financial burden. Therefore, in general, having accident insurance is very important for everyone.
Insured age
Accident insurance, like other insurance products, has an age limit for coverage. For example, Generali Bravo Shield Hospital Income Plan covers newborn babies and elderly aged 70 only. If you plan to buy accident insurance for children or the elderly, you need to pay attention to whether the insurance plan has an insurance age limit.
Be aware of common exclusions in accident insurance
Before applying for insurance, the policyholder should take the time to understand the exclusions of accident insurance. For example, some insurance companies do not cover accidental casualties and medical expenses caused by high-risk activities, natural disasters, etc., but some companies will extend the coverage to high-risk activities.
Consider personal and family needs
The most important thing before purchasing personal accident insurance is to understand the needs of you and your family. If your family is quite big, you might benefit from AXA SmartProtect Plus - Basic Plan which provides coverage for three generations of family members.
Occupation of the policyholder may affect premiums
As the risks faced by each occupation are different, the premiums may vary. Generally speaking, it is classified into below 4 categories:
Category 1 Policyholders engaged in clerical duties without the involvement of manual work
Category 2 Insured persons engaged in and/or in supervision of non-manual outdoor work
Category 3 Policyholders engaged in light manual labor (without the use of heavy machinery)
Category 4 People who do manual labor
FAQ
Who needs personal accident insurance?
Accidents can happen to people of all ages and occupations, so it is recommended that everyone should have accident insurance.
What does personal accident insurance cover?
Generally speaking, the coverage of accident insurance includes accidental death dismemberment permanent disability and weekly allowance during temporary disablement medical expenses.
Is there an age limit for personal accident insurance?
Personal accident insurance has an age limit, generally ranging from 6 months to 70 or 80 years old.
What is the difference between personal accident insurance and life insurance?
Personal accident insurance is more targeted than life insurance, covering death or serious injury caused by "external accidents not caused by illness".
Does accident insurance cover critical illness?
No. in general, critical illness insurance covers serious illnesses such as cancer, stroke, heart attack, etc.
Can I take out personal accident insurance?
In general, personal accident coverage is available as long as you meet the age requirement
Do I need to undergo a medical examination before applying for personal accident insurance?
Not necessarily, but some insurance companies may ask you to undergo a medical examination before approving your application.
